Package io.github.ai4ci.flow

package io.github.ai4ci.flow
Simulation execution and data flow management for agent-based modelling.

This package now centralises the core execution and export infrastructure following a recent refactor that moved execution builders, monitoring and exporters into the io.github.ai4ci.flow package and the io.github.ai4ci.flow.output subpackage.

Core components now located in this package

  • ExecutionBuilder - orchestrates setup, baselining and initialisation steps to create runnable simulations
  • SimulationExecutor - executes an individual simulation to completion with thread management and monitoring
  • SimulationFactory - preconfigures and caches simulation instances for batch execution
  • SimulationMonitor - oversees multiple simulation executions and manages resource allocation and throttling

Export and writer components (flow.output)

Export and writer implementations have been grouped under the io.github.ai4ci.flow.output subpackage. Notable types include:

  • SimulationExporter - coordinates export of simulation records at the configured stages
  • OutputWriter - base interface for concrete writers
  • CSVWriter - writes records to CSV
  • DuckDBWriter - writes records to DuckDB database files
  • QueueWriter - buffered writer for asynchronous export
  • Export and ExportSelector - annotations and helper interfaces that describe what to export and when

Execution lifecycle

The typical lifecycle of a simulation is:

  1. Factory setup: SimulationFactory constructs ready instances
  2. Initialisation: ExecutionBuilder prepares model state
  3. Execution loop: SimulationExecutor advances time and emits export records at configured stages
  4. Monitoring: SimulationMonitor throttles and supervises runs
  5. Completion: exporters flush and resources are reclaimed

Data export pipeline

Exported records are produced at defined stages (for example START, BASELINE, UPDATE and FINISH) and routed to the appropriate writer. The pipeline ensures export occurs before state mutation so that exported rows represent the pre‑update state for each time step.

Integration points

The flow package integrates with the simulation model and configuration:

  • Outbreak - core simulation model
  • SetupConfiguration - model structure configuration used by builders
  • ExecutionConfiguration - runtime parameter configuration consulted during initialisation and export
  • Updater - time step advancement logic used by executors

Usage example

 SimulationMonitor monitor = new SimulationMonitor();
 SimulationFactory factory = new SimulationFactory();
 ExecutionBuilder builder = new ExecutionBuilder(...);
 SimulationExporter exporter = new SimulationExporter();

 SimulationExecutor executor = new SimulationExecutor(monitor, factory.create(), exporter, 1000);
 monitor.submit(executor);

Downstream consumers: exporters and writers in flow.output and analytics or notebooks that consume CSV or DuckDB outputs generated by the writers.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    ExecutionBuilder
    Builder that orchestrates setup, baselining and initialisation of an Outbreak instance for an experiment.
    SimulationExecutor
    Executes a single simulation to completion under supervision by the monitor.
    SimulationFactory
    Factory for pre-configuring and caching simulation instances for batch execution.
    SimulationMonitor
    There is one monitor thread running during the simulation.
